newsitem.title: USA: Union Planters to buy Magna Bancorp.
newsitem.headline: Union Planters to buy Magna Bancorp.

text.p: Union Planters Corp. said Thursday it agreed to acquire Magna Bancorp Inc., another banking company based in the South, in a stock exchange valued at about $323 million.
The combined company will be the third largest financial institution in Mississippi.
Under the agreement, Memphis, Tenn.-based Union Planters will offer about 0.5165 shares of its common stock for each Magna share in a tax-free pooling of interests.
Based on Union Planters' closing price of $45.50 on the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday, the offer is worth $23.50 per share. Magna rose 75 cents to $18.25 on Nasdaq.
The deal is expected to close late in the third quarter or early in the fourth quarter, subject to approval by Magna shareholders and regulators.
Union Planters, with $15 billion in assets, has over 430 banking offices in Tennessee, Mississipi, Missouri, Arkansas, Alabama, Louisiana and Kentucky.
Magna, based in Hattiesburg, Miss., is the largest thrift and the sixth largest financial institution in Mississippi, as well as the largest thrift in Alabama.

Magna Bancorp, with assets of $1.3 billion, is parent of Magnolia Federal Bank of Savings, which operates 62 banking locations in Mississippi and south Alabama. Magna also operates Magna Mortgage Co., with $3.1 billion in loans.
